001package org.consensusj.daemon.micronaut;
002
003import io.micronaut.runtime.event.annotation.EventListener;
004import io.micronaut.runtime.server.EmbeddedServer;
005import io.micronaut.runtime.server.event.ServerShutdownEvent;
006import io.micronaut.runtime.server.event.ServerStartupEvent;
007import jakarta.inject.Singleton;
008import org.bitcoinj.kits.WalletAppKit;
009import org.consensusj.bitcoin.services.WalletAppKitService;
010import org.slf4j.Logger;
011import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
012
013import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
014
015// TODO: Rather than subclass WalletAppKitService there should be a RPCServerShutdown class or interface
016// that is passed in to  WalletAppKitService that it can all when `stop` is called.
017/**
018 * Subclass of {@link WalletAppKitService} that implements the {@code stop} JSON-RPC method using
019 * Micronaut {@link EmbeddedServer#stop()}
020 */
021@Singleton
022public class MicronautWalletAppKitService extends WalletAppKitService {
023    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(MicronautWalletAppKitService.class);
024
025    private EmbeddedServer embeddedServer;
026
027    public MicronautWalletAppKitService(WalletAppKit kit) {
028        super(kit);
029    }
030    
031    @EventListener
032    public void onStartup(ServerStartupEvent event) {
033        log.info("Saving reference to embeddedServer");
034        embeddedServer = event.getSource();
035    }
036
037    @EventListener
038    public void onShutdown(ServerShutdownEvent event) {
039        log.info("Shutting down");
040        this.close();
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * Initiate server shutdown. This is a JSON-RPC method and will initiate but not
045     * complete server-shutdown because it must return a response to the client.
046     * @return A status string indicating the server is stopping
047     */
048    @Override
049    public CompletableFuture<String> stop() {
050        log.info("stop");
051        embeddedServer.stop();
052        var appName = embeddedServer.getApplicationConfiguration().getName().orElse("server");
053        return result(appName + " stopping");
054    }
055}
